page.lettertext:
fol.221r
[Bel]
gia
[15]
92
[1]
2 June To M
r
Bodly
Right wo
r
shipfull: We understand that yt hathe pleased
her
majestye
once again to wryte one our behalfe unto
the
States generall
by one
M
r
Burnhame
, whether the
[y]
have made aunswear thereunto or not, or what there
aunswear mighte be we hear not as yet, may yt please
you therefore, yf there be any thing donne to advertise us
thereof, yf not to hasten them forewardes, that knowing
their mindes in tyme we may the better provide aswell
for remedy or our greifes already conceived of that which is
already provisionally passed, as also prevente those
Inconveniences, which we doubt may accompanie their
resolutione upon those twoe pointes, which yet remaine to
be discided betweene this and Auguste./ Herein as often
heretofore we are bolde in craving yo
r
assistance to be
over troublesome, wishing that one our parte we mighte
anye way be able to shew our gratefulnes for the same
wherewithall right wo
r
shipfull we c
o
mitt you to the
protectione of the Almighty whoe prosper all yo
r
affaires.
Middelburch the 12
th
of June a
o
1592
Yo
r
wo
r
shippes at comandment the Deputye associates and generality of the m
r
chantes adventurers. Thomas Ferrers Deputy
